original: Larsson, Joel direktör, Göteborg, f. 10/12/95 i Jumikil, Upps. 1., av Johan L. o. Edla Thörnlund. G. 22 m. inge-borg Enblom. Barn: Brita f. 23, g. m. fänriken v. flvgv. Axel Bergenstjerna, Gbg, Plans 25"^, stud., Ake 25, stud. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 14, bergsing:ex. v. KTH 19, stud. v. univ. i Sheffield 24. Stud:res. t. Tyskl., Engl. o. Frankr. 24, USA 30. Anst. v. A-B Mangano-Silicium i Trollhättan 20’, Sthlms gasverk 20-21, Jernkont. 22-23, SKF i Gbg 23-25, lab:chef v. SKF Hofors Bruk 25-29, övering. där 30-37 o. disp. 37-41, v. verkst. dir. i SKF sed. 41. Styr :led. i Krångede A-B, Skogens Kol A-B, Norbergs Gruv A-B, A-B Pripp & Lyckholm m. fl. bol., Järn-bruksförb., Bruksind :fören., Skogssäll-sk. i Gbg, fullm. i Jernkont. m. m. Skr.: upps. i Jernkont. Annaler. RVO.
translated: Larsson, Joel, director, Gothenburg, born on October 12, 1895 in Jumikil, Uppsala County, 1st child of Johan L. and Edla Thörnlund. Married on the 22nd with Ingeborg Enblom. Children: Brita, born in 1923, married to Lieutenant Axel Bergenstjerna of the Royal Swedish Army Aviation, residing in Gothenburg, Plan 25. Studying at Ake University. Completed exams at Uppsala University in 1914, obtained a mining engineer degree at KTH in 1919, studied at the University of Sheffield in 1924. Studied abroad in Germany, England, and France in 1924, and in the USA in 1930. Employed at AB Mangano-Silicium in Trollhättan from 1920, Stockholm Gas Plant from 1920-1921, Jernkontoret from 1922-1923, SKF in Gothenburg from 1923-1925, laboratory manager at SKF Hofors Works from 1925-1929, chief engineer there from 1930-1937, and then director from 1937-1941. Board member of Krångede AB, Skogens Kol AB, Norbergs Gruv AB, AB Pripp & Lyckholm, and other companies. Board member of Jernbruksförbundet, Bruksindustrins Förening, and Skogssällskapet in Gothenburg. Representative of Jernkontoret, among others. Published in Jernkontoret Annals. Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).
